actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on November 13, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Cleaver moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2143.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Higgins (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 2143 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 320 South 2nd Avenue in Sioux Falls, South Dakota, as the "Staff Sergeant Robb Lura Rolfing Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3419.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Higgins (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3419 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 1765 Camp Hill Bypass in Camp Hill, Pennsylvania, as the "John Charles Traub Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3267.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Higgins (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3267 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 410 Dakota Avenue South in Huron, South Dakota, as the "First Lieutenant Thomas Michael Martin Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2274.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Higgins (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 2274 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 112 Wyoming Street in Shoshoni, Wyoming, as the "Dessie A. Bebout Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1510.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Higgins (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 1510 — "To amend provisions relating to the Office of the Inspector General of the Government Accountability Office, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House observed a moment of silence in memory of the Honorable Dave Hobson.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Failed by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 256

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 9495 — "To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to postpone tax deadlines and reimburse paid late fees for United States nationals who are unlawfully or wrongfully detained or held hostage abroad, to terminate the tax-exempt status of terrorist supporting organizations, and for other purposes."

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Failed by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 175
actions-list.actionItem: 225, 1 Present (Roll no. 457).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 5342 — "To amend title II of the Social Security Act to replace the windfall elimination provision with a formula equalizing benefits for certain individuals with noncovered employment, and for other purposes."

actions-list.header: ADJUSTMENT OF THE WHOLE NUMBER OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Under Clause 5(d) of Rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the administration of the Oath of Office to the gentlewoman from Texas, Mrs. Lee Carter, and the gentleman from Wisconsin, Mr. Wied, the whole number of the House is 434.

Representatives-Elect Erica Lee Carter, Eighteenth District, State of Texas, and Tony Wied, Eighth District, State of Wisconsin, presented themselves in the well of the House for the purpose of taking the Oath of Office which was administered by the Speaker of the House.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. The Acting Clerk transmitted to the House a copy of a letter received from Ms. Meagan Wolfe, Administrator, with the Wisconsin Elections Commission indicating that, according to the unofficial results for the Special General Election held on November 5, 2024, the Honorable Tony Wied was elected Representative to Congress for the Eighth Congressional District of Wisconsin.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. The Acting Clerk transmitted to the House a copy of a letter received from Ms. Christina Adkins, Director of Elections, with the Texas Office of the Secretary of State indicating that, according to the unofficial results for the Special General Election held on November 5, 2024, the Honorable Erica Lee Carter was elected Representative to Congress for the Eighteenth Congressional District of Texas.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 327
actions-list.actionItem: 75, 1 Present (Roll no. 456).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 82 — "To amend title II of the Social Security Act to repeal the Government pension offset and windfall elimination provisions."
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on motions to suspend the rules which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5301.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Higgins (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5301 — "To amend title 31, United States Code, to require agencies to include a list of outdated or duplicative reporting requirements in annual budget justifications, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9596.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Higgins (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 9596 — "To amend title 41, United States Code, and title 10, United States Code, to provide best value through the multiple award schedule program, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9592.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Higgins (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 9592 — "To amend title 44, United States Code, to modernize the Federal Register, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9597.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Higgins (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 9597 — "To amend title 41, United States Code, to make changes with respect to the Federal Acquisition Security Council, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Doggett objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9495.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 9495 — "To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to postpone tax deadlines and reimburse paid late fees for United States nationals who are unlawfully or wrongfully detained or held hostage abroad, to terminate the tax-exempt status of terrorist supporting organizations, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 82.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 82 — "To amend title II of the Social Security Act to repeal the Government pension offset and windfall elimination provisions."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5342.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Arrington moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 5342 — "To amend title II of the Social Security Act to replace the windfall elimination provision with a formula equalizing benefits for certain individuals with noncovered employment, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of November 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
Mr. Harris asked unanimous consent that the order of the House on November 5, 2024, with respect to H.R. 82 be vacated. Agreed to without objection.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of November 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
